data.question: What is the chemical formula of POST-66(Y)?
data.answer: The chemical formula of POST-66(Y) is [{Y4(H2O)}3(hmtt)8](OH)6(NO3)6·70 DMF·67 H2O.

data.question: What method was used to confirm the Lewis acidic sites of POST-66(Y) were partially preserved in POST-66(Y)-wt-24h?
data.answer: In situ IR spectroscopy using acetonitrile as a probe molecule was used to confirm the Lewis acidic sites of POST-66(Y) were partially preserved in POST-66(Y)-wt-24h.

data.question: What changes in porosity were observed in POST-66(Y) after water treatment for 24 hours?
data.answer: After water treatment for 24 hours, POST-66(Y) exhibited a change from a type I to type IV isotherm, indicating a transition from microporous to mesoporous material.

data.question: How does the temperature of water treatment affect the microporous-to-mesoporous transformation of POST-66(Y)?
data.answer: Increasing the temperature of water treatment to 80°C made the microporous-to-mesoporous transformation of POST-66(Y) proceed more rapidly, generating larger mesopores.

data.question: What was the outcome of encapsulating horseradish peroxidase (HRP) in POST-66(Y)-wt-24h?
data.answer: Encapsulating horseradish peroxidase (HRP) in POST-66(Y)-wt-24h resulted in enhanced enzyme stability and recyclability, with the ability to catalyze the co-oxidation of 4-aminoantiprine and phenol.

data.question: True or False: The hydrolytic post-synthetic procedure used to transform POST-66(Y) into a hierarchical micro- and mesoporous MOF is a complex and unreliable method.
data.answer: False

data.question: True or False: The mesoporous MOFs produced by the hydrolytic post-synthetic procedure have pore sizes smaller than 5 nm.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the significance of the study's contribution to the synthesis of hierarchical porous MOFs?
data.answer: The study presents a new approach to constructing hierarchical micro- and mesoporous MOFs from microporous MOFs through a simple hydrolytic process, offering a method to control pore sizes and demonstrating the potential for various applications including enzyme immobilization.

data.question: What was used to monitor the leaching of metal ions during the hydrolytic transformation of POST-66(Y)?
data.answer: ICP-AES was used to monitor the leaching of metal ions during the hydrolytic transformation of POST-66(Y).

data.question: True or False: The hydrolytic transformation of POST-66(Y) into a hierarchical micro- and mesoporous MOF is irreversible.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the observed effect of water treatment on the surface area and pore volume of POST-66(Y)?
data.answer: Water treatment resulted in a decrease in surface area from 2400 m2 g-1 to 620 m2 g-1 and an increase in total specific pore volume from 0.89 cm3 g-1 to 0.94 cm3 g-1, indicating a loss of microporosity and emergence of mesoporosity.

data.question: True or False: The hydrolytic post-synthetic procedure can only be applied to POST-66(Y) and not to other MOFs.
data.answer: False

data.question: What was the main purpose of using water as a dissolution agent in the study?
data.answer: The main purpose of using water as a dissolution agent was to create additional mesopores in the microporous MOF POST-66(Y) by inducing mesopores in the framework.

data.question: True or False: The study demonstrated that the hierarchical porous MOF POST-66(Y)-wt can only encapsulate small molecules and not large guest molecules such as proteins.
data.answer: False

data.question: What was the effect of increasing the water treatment temperature on the size of mesopores generated in POST-66(Y)?
data.answer: Increasing the water treatment temperature to 80°C resulted in the generation of larger mesopores, with sizes even larger than those formed by 12 hours of treatment at room temperature.

data.question: True or False: The study's approach to synthesizing hierarchical porous MOFs requires elaborate synthetic procedures.
data.answer: False

data.question: How did the study confirm the generation of mesopores in POST-66(Y)-wt-24h?
data.answer: The generation of mesopores in POST-66(Y)-wt-24h was confirmed through various electron microscopic studies, including scanning electron microscopy (SEM), transmission electron microscopy (TEM), and scanning transmission electron microscopy (STEM), illustrating the development of mesopores.

data.question: What was the observed effect on the catalytic activity of horseradish peroxidase (HRP) when embedded in POST-66(Y)-wt-24h?
data.answer: Embedding horseradish peroxidase (HRP) in POST-66(Y)-wt-24h catalyzed the reaction with a reaction rate of 6.94 x 10-5 mmol L s-1, indicating enhanced catalytic activity compared to the absence of activity in POST-66(Y)-wt-24h alone.

data.question: True or False: The study demonstrated that the hierarchical porous MOF POST-66(Y)-wt can be utilized as a solid support for immobilization of enzymes to achieve better stability and recyclability.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the role of the hydrolytic post-synthetic procedure in the transformation of POST-66(Y) into a hierarchical micro- and mesoporous MOF?
data.answer: The hydrolytic post-synthetic procedure played a crucial role in transforming POST-66(Y) into a hierarchical micro- and mesoporous MOF by inducing mesopores in the framework through simple water treatment, while maintaining the original microporous structure, at least in part.
